bibl.title: Letter from Walter Reed to the Surgeon General, June 1, 1900

div1.p: Reed acknowledges the receipt of a check for $50.00 for use in the Medical Board's research.

div1.head: Letter from Walter Reed to the Surgeon General, June 1, 1900
div1.opener:
OFFICE OF SURGEON GENERAL,
JUN 1
1900
B
71980
WAR DEPARTMENT.
SURGEON GENERAL'S OFFICE
Army Medical Museum,
June 1, 1900.
REED, WALTER, MAJ. & SURGEON,
U. S. Army.
Acknowledges receipt of check
for $50.00 for purchase of animals
etc., in connection with investiga-
tions to be made by Board convened
by Par. 34, S.O. No. 122, A.G.O.,
C.S.
All communications to this Office should be addressed “To the Surgeon General, U. S. Army, Washington, D. C.”
Reed
Subject: Check for $50.00
WAR DEPARTMENT,
Surgeon General's Office,
U. S. Army Medical Museum and Library,
Corner 7th and B Streets SW.,
Washington June 1, 1900.
TO THE SURGEON GENERAL,
U. S. Army.
Sir:
div1.p:
I beg to acknowledge the receipt of check for fifty
dollars ($50.00), to be used in the purchase of animals and
for other incidental expenses in connection with the investi-
gations to be made by Board convened by Par. 34, S.O. No. 122,
A. G. O. May 29, 1900.
div1.closer:
Very respectfully, Walter Reed, Major & Surgeon,
U. S. Army.
